text.name: CP_infoText
text.text: Courseplay(%s): Für Hilfe, Fehler oder Patch Notes, bitte hier vorbei schauen: https://github.com/Courseplay/Courseplay_FS22.

text.name: CP_error_no_course
text.text: Erstelle zuerst einen Kurs vor dem starten.

text.name: CP_error_could_not_generate_course
text.text: Konnte keinen Kurs generieren. Das Logfile könnte weitere Informationen enthalten.

text.name: CP_error_not_on_field
text.text: Ziel ist nicht auf einem Feld.

text.name: CP_jobParameters_laneOffset_tooltip
text.text: Bahnauswahl wenn ein Multitoolkurs erstellt wurde.

text.name: CP_ai_messageErrorIsFull
text.text: Helfer %s hat die Arbeit gestoppt - Gerät ist voll!

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_showCourse_tooltip
text.text: Zeigt den Kurs des aktuell gewählten Fahrzeugs.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_openHudWithMouse_tooltip
text.text: Wenn deaktiviert, kann das Hud nur über die Tastenbelegung geöffnet werden.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_fuelSave_tooltip
text.text: Schaltet des Fahrzeug aus, wenn es warten muss.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_stopAtEnd_tooltip
text.text: Fahrzeug bleibt nach der Arbeit am Endpunkt stehen.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_allowReversePathfinding_tooltip
text.text: Erlaubt dem Pathfinder einen rückwärts Kurs zu generieren.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_allowPathfinderTurns_tooltip
text.text: Aktiviert den Pathfinder für Wendemanöver, zum Beispiel um Objekten oder der Frucht auszuweichen.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_foldImplementAtEnd_tooltip
text.text: Geräte am Ende des Kurses einklappen oder nicht.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_turnOnField_tooltip
text.text: Versucht beim Wendemanöver auf dem Feld zu bleiben. Nicht mit allen Geräten möglich.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_avoidFruit_tooltip
text.text: Versucht nach Möglichst nicht in der Frucht zu fahren.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_useAdditiveFillUnit_tooltip
text.text: Wenn aktiv und das Siliermittel leer ist, wird der Fahrer gestoppt.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_pipeAlwaysUnfold_tooltip
text.text: Rohr ausfahren, wenn der Drescher voll ist und auf den Abfahrer wartet.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_stopForUnload_tooltip
text.text: Drescher bleibt stehen, solange er entladen wird.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_selfUnload_tooltip
text.text: Drescher sucht sich einen Trailer in der nähe des Feldes um dort selber ab zu tanken. Not supported in multitools or convoy mode.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_unloadOnFirstHeadland_tooltip
text.text: Wenn aktiv, wird der Abfaher auf im ersten Vorgewende gerufen.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_strawSwath_tooltip
text.text: Strohablage an, aus oder aus nur im Vorgewende.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_sowingMachineFertilizerEnabled_tooltip
text.text: Düngefunktion der Saatmaschine ein oder ausschalten.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_optionalSowingMachineEnabled_tooltip
text.text: Schaltet die zusätzliche Saatfunktion des Gerätes ein oder aus.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_fieldWorkSpeed_tooltip
text.text: Maximale Geschwindigkeit bei der Feldarbeit. Value: 5 - 50

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_fieldSpeed_tooltip
text.text: Maximale Geschwindigkeit auf dem Feld. Value: 5 - 50

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_reverseSpeed_tooltip
text.text: Maximale Geschwindigkeit beim rückwärts fahren. Value: 2 - 25

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_debugActive_tooltip
text.text: Debuginformationen für das Fahrzeug ein- und ausschalten. Visuell und Logeinträge

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_headlandOverlapPercent_tooltip
text.text: Überlappung Vorgewende in % der Arbeitsbreite. Value: 0 - 25

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_fieldMargin_tooltip
text.text: Positive Werte reduzieren die Feldgröße, negative Werte vergrößern den Arbeitsbereich. Value: -2 - 5.8

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_rowsToSkip_tooltip
text.text: Reihen zum überspringen wenn auf Bahnen gewechselt wird. Wert: 0 - 6

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_rowsPerLand_tooltip
text.text: Wenn Zentrierung Beet ausgewählt ist, dann befinden sich soviele Reihen im Block. Value: 0 - 24

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_isClockwise_tooltip
text.text: Soll das Fahrzeug auf dem Vorgewende im oder gegen den Uhrzeigersinn fahren

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_rowDirection_tooltip
text.text: Richtung in der die Bahnen gefahren werden sollen.

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_manualRowAngleDeg_tooltip
text.text: Winkel der Bahnen (0 ist Norden) wenn Einstellung auf Manuell gesetzt ist. Value: 0 - 175 Steps: 5

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_islandBypassMode_tooltip
text.text: Wie soll die Insel auf dem Feld umfahren werden.

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_startOnHeadland_tooltip
text.text: Startpunkt auf dem Vorgewende oder auf den Bahnen

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_multiTools_tooltip
text.text: Wieviele Fahrzeuge sollten zusammen auf dem Kurs fahren.

text.name: CP_vehicle_vineCourseGeneratorSetting_vineCenterOffset_tooltip
text.text: Soll der Kurs auf oder neben der Rebe gesetzt werden. Das ist abhängig vom verwendeten Gerät. Mehr Informationen im Hilfe Menü.

text.name: CP_vehicle_vineCourseGeneratorSetting_vineMultiTools_tooltip
text.text: Wieviele Geräte können auf diesem Kurs arbeiten. Mehr Information im Hilfemenü.

text.name: CP_vehicle_vineCourseGeneratorSetting_vineRowsToSkip_tooltip
text.text: Wieviele Reben sollen übersprungen werden. Das hilft bei Geräten mit höherem Wenderadius.

text.name: CP_global_setting_wageModifier_tooltip
text.text: Fahrerlohn für CP Arbeiter, prozentual von dem standart Lohn.

text.name: CP_global_setting_autoRepair_tooltip
text.text: CP Fahrer reparieren automatisch ihre Fahrzeuge und Geräte.

text.name: CP_global_setting_controllerHudSelected_tooltip
text.text: Benutze das Hud, welches sich über den Controller bedienen lässt.

text.name: CP_global_setting_showActionEventHelp_tooltip
text.text: Schaltet die Anzeige der Tastenbelegung an und aus.

text.name: CP_global_setting_maxDeltaAngleAtGoal_tooltip
text.text: Maximaler zulässiger Winkel am Ziel. Kleine Winkel sind genauer, große schneller

text.name: CP_global_setting_deltaAngleRelaxFactor_tooltip
text.text: Faktor um die Pathfindergenauigkeit bei gescheiterten Versuchen zu senken. Größere Werte sind schneller

text.name: CP_global_setting_showsAllActiveCourses_tooltip
text.text: Zeigt alle geladenen Kurse auf der Map.

text.name: CP_global_setting_infoTextHudActive_tooltip
text.text: Schaltet das Infofenster für die CP Helfer an oder aus.

text.name: CP_global_setting_infoTextHudPlayerMouseActive_tooltip
text.text: Aktiviert/deaktiviert die Maus Interaktion außerhalb eines Fahrzeugs.

text.name: CP_global_setting_preferCustomFields_tooltip
text.text: Prefer custom field if there is also a regular field at the selected position.

text.name: CP_customFieldManager_confirm_save
text.text: Möchtest du diesen benutzerdefinierten Randkurs als %s speichern?

text.name: CP_help_page_startJobMenuBase_text
text.text: When selecting a vehicle, you will see it's loaded course and the coursemanager (if there is one loaded), and the vehicle options. The global settings are always present. With create a job, you will not only gain access the default Jobs from FS22, but also to CP: Fieldwork and CP: wrap/collect bales.

text.name: CP_help_page_startJobMenuFunctions_text
text.text: To start off with your first CP Job, you have to select a vehicle with a valid tool attached. Then, by clicking on create job, you can select CP: Fieldwork for fieldwork tools or CP: wrap/collect ables with a bale wrapper or bale collector attached.

text.name: CP_help_page_readyJobMenuBase_text
text.text: With CP: Fieldwork selected, you have a Target position, wich you might know from the Giants Helper and a new Field position. That field position is used to select the field where you want to work on, as well as the start point of the course (or Endpoint). If you let Giants drive your vehicle to the field to start the job, with start at: you can choose where the CP Driver will start. Lane offset is only used in multitool courses, more about that in a later topic.

text.name: CP_help_page_readyJobMenuFunctions_text
text.text: The target position is only used if you will start the job from that menu, it will tell the Giants Helper to drive to that location and give controll over to courseplay. As said before, field position is to select the field and must be placed in order to open the generator. Depending on where to start the fieldwork, the field position will also tell the generator where the start or end point should be. If you have a valid field, the border will be highlighted in a white line. Now you are able to open the course generator. More about this in the next topic.

text.name: CP_help_page_JobMenuExtras_text
text.text: When you have a generated course, you can else start the Job (remember to set a Target position) or drive by yourself to the field and use the HUD to start the course. Alternatively you can use AutoDrive to drive to a AutoDrive Target and start CP.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorBase_text
text.text: The course generator is the core of the Fieldwork. With this tool you will generate a course, based on the field condition and the settings you choose, how your helper should work on the field. You can always change values and hit generate course and have a look, what impact does a certain value have on your course. Experimenting with it and lear on how each setting work, is the best way to get used to it.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorBaseFunctions_text
text.text: Basics: The first few values you see here, are realy basic stuff. - Work width: Most tools get the exact work width detected and you won't have to care about this setting at all. Adjusting it, will have an impact of your overall course. - Multiple Tools: That setting is used, when you want more then just 1 Tool to work on your course. As this gets a bit more complicated, there is an own help topic for it. - Number of Headlands: The best way to keep your tools on the fied while doing their job, is to add Headlands. The Number of the Headlands multiplied by the work width should but at least the total length of your vehicle plus the attached tool Center options: - Field center: There are different modes on how your field center pattern should look like. The classic and most used one is up/down. Spiral, Racetrack and Lands have their own specific advantages over the others. Lands for example will have Combines pipe point out of the fruit most of the time to easier unload them. - Up/Down row direction: automatic mostly finds the best direction, but sometimes the longest edge fits better. If you are not happy with either one, choose manual and set the direction manually. - Rows to skip: This is a very helpful option to accelerate your work, as tools won't have to back up to turn into the next close row. - Rows per Land: This have only impact when field center is set to lands and will tell the generator how many rows each land should have. The more rows, the lesser lands will be generated. - Up/down row angle: As said before, when the Up/Down row direction is set to manual, this setting will tell the generate the direction.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorHeadland_text
text.text: Headland settings will only show up, when you have set at least one at Number of headlands. You gain options for where to start on, corner settings, direction and overlap. Headlands are highly suggested to prevent tools leaving the field for their turns.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorHeadlandFunctions_text
text.text: - Star work on: As mentioned in the extended AI Menu, the field position is used to set the start or end position for the field work course. When set to start on headland, it tells where the start should be. When changed to start on rows, it will tell where to end the work. - Headland corners: Smooth will have a simple smoothing over the corners, This works all tools, but will lead into tiny unworked patches. They can be reduced with overlap, but never disappear. Sharp will generate a turn based on the angle of the fieldborder angle. Round will take the current selected vehicles turn radius into account to have the best round corner for that tool. Headland direction: clockwise or counter-clockwise. This can be important for Combine and Harvester, depending on wich side the pipe or convayer belt is. Headland overlap: How much % overlap all Headlands should have. The 1st one will have no overlap with the field border, but the inner ones will overlap with theri neighbour.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorExtras_text
text.text: Field Margin explanation: Positive values reduce field size to add a buffer around the worked area in case you have obstacles near the field border. Negative values enlarge worked area beyond the field boundary to cover up field borders that are not perfectly detected.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerBase_text
text.text: The path to the course files is: ..\My Games\FarmingSimulator2022\modSettings\FS22_Courseplay\Courses\Mapname.SampleModMap (Or for Vanilla e.g. MapUS). The coursemanager works different from what you are used in FS19. When you create a folder, it will also be created at that location. You will need at least one folder to save your course.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerBaseFunctions_text
text.text: When you have a course loaded, you can save it by clicking on the folder where you want to save it, a pop up window will appear where you can enter the name of your course. The name and location can be changed later. To remove the course from your vehicle, click on 'Clear current course'. To load a course, you have to select the folder first, then click on load course and then on the course you want to load. Clicking on change mode, acticvates the edit mode of the course manager.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerEdit_text
text.text: There are 7 different action available: Is the edit mode active, you can: - Moving a course in to another directory. - Deleting a course or directory. - Renaming a course or directory.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerEditFunctions_text
text.text: To move a course, you just click on 'move entry', then click on the course, then click on the new folder where you want to move it. Rename is even more simple, click on 'rename', click on the course and the same pop up window (like when you save the course) will appear. For deleting a course or a folder, you will be asked if you rly want to do it. Pls note that, to delete a folder, it has to be empty! A pop up window will inform you, if that folder sill contains a course.

text.name: CP_help_page_minihud_text
text.text: A: Clicking on the vehicle name opens the vehicle configurations page. B: Toggle where to start the course with one click. C: Clicking on the coursename you will open the AI Menu with the course generator open. D: Start the Courseplay helper. E: Shows current waypoint / total waypoints. Click to open the course manager. F: Clicking on the icon opens the general settings page. G: Closes the HUD. H: Decrease and increase the working width. A red line on your vehicle shows the current setting. I: Value for horizontal offset, + left, - right. J: Value for vertical offset, + backward, - forward. K, L and M: Clicking on the text will reset your changes to the auto values. N: This area shows the lane offset if you have a multitool course loaded. Clicking on the text toggles the positions. O: Start/stop recording a custom field course. P: Removes course from vehicle

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldRecord_text
text.text: There are two ways to create a custom field. The first one is to use the record function of the HUD. Start the record and record your field border. Once done, press the button again and you will be asked if you want to save it.

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldDone_text
text.text: Having a look on the AI Menu, you will see your recorded field border. By clicking on the Name, you will get the option to either delete it or rename it.

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldDraw_text
text.text: The second option is to draw it on the AI Menu Map. Have no tractor or other vehicle selected (left click somewhere on the map), you get the option to draw a custom field. When started, the text draw custom field lines with right click will be displayed. Use the right mouse button to click on a position on where you want to start. The next right click will draw a line from your startpoint to your second position, wich will be the start point for the next line.

text.name: input_CP_DBG_CHANNEL_MENU_VISIBILITY
text.text: CP: Zeigt debug channels menu ja/nein.
